intro: Poikilospermum acuminatum, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its clustered white flowers that resemble small balls, blooming in winter. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is typically found in rocky or sandy soils. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
